children.value: Hubble.gl is a JavaScript library for animating data visualizations.

Guaranteed smooth framerates, high resolutions, and a variety of formats. Render the quality you want at the speed you need it. Fine tune timing and look with keyframe markers and render everything in the same app.
Stand up scenes within deck.gl or kepler.gl, then animate any aspect of it. Empower users to animate without code with UI components included in this library.
Videos render and encode directly in the web browser. User data never leaves their machine. Since nothing runs on a server sites can scale without computation costs.
To create an animation and render you will need to first create a
project. Then you will need to create a
function for each scene where you'll define all of the elements of your animation, including any async data fetching.
for rendering a variety of video and image sequence formats. Hubble.gl provide a
hook for React.js, which is used to trigger a update when necessary.
